ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:0.3_0: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:0.5_0: 28. The training rule on boarding boats
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six boarded boats by appointment with nuns.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:1.3_0: People then complained and criticized those nuns,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:1.4_0: “Just as we enjoy ourselves on boats with our wives, so these Sakyan ascetics make appointments with nuns and then enjoy themselves on boats.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:1.5_0: The monks heard those people complaining,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:1.6_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Devadatta,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:1.7_0: “How can the monks from the group of six board boats by appointments with nuns?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:1.8_0: “Is it true, monks, that you do this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:1.11_0: “... Foolish men, how can you board boats by appointments with nuns?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:1.12_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:1.13_0: the Buddha said, “And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:1.14.1_0: ‘If a monk boards a boat by appointment with a nun, either to go upstream or downstream, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:1.15_0: The Buddha has laid down a training rule for the monks.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:2.1_0: On one occasion a number of monks and nuns were traveling from Sāketa to Sāvatthī.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:2.2_0: On the way they had to cross a river,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:2.3_0: The nuns said to the monks,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:2.5_0: “Sisters, it’s not allowable for us to board a boat by appointment with a nun.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:2.6_0: You cross first, or we will.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:2.7_0: “Venerables, I have served the best of men.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:2.9_0: But because the nuns crossed afterwards, they were robbed and raped by bandits.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:2.10_0: When they arrived at Sāvatthī they told the nuns there what had happened.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:2.13_0: who gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:2.14_0: “Monks, I allow you to board a boat by appointment with a nun if it’s for the purpose of crossing.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:2.15_0: the Buddha said, “And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:2.16.1_0: ‘If a monk boards a boat by appointment with a nun, either to go upstream or downstream, except for the purpose of crossing, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.1.2_0: and you have the same kind of perception ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.1.4_0: ... The monks who have been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.1.8_0: The Buddha then sat down together.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.1.10_2: If he boards or makes a boat in today, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.1.11_0: If the monk boards when the nun has already boarded, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.1.12_0: If the nun boards when the monks has already boarded, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.1.13_0: If both boards when he understands, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.1.15_0: for the purpose of going against the stream.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.1.17_0: for the purpose of going with the stream.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.1.18_0: Except for the purpose of crossing:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.1.19_0: unless it is for the purpose of crossing.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.1.20_0: when the villages are a chicken’s flight apart, then for every next village he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.1.21_0: When it is an uninhabited area, a wilderness, then for every six kilometers he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.2.1_0: If there is an appointment, and he perceives that there is, and he boards a boat with a nun, either to go upstream or downstream, except for the purpose of crossing, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.2.2_0: If there is an appointment, but he is unsure of it, and he boards a boat with a nun, either to go upstream or downstream, except for the purpose of crossing, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.2.3_0: If there is an appointment, but he perceives that there is not, and he boards a boat with a nun, either to go upstream or downstream, except for the purpose of crossing, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.2.4_0: If the monk makes an appointment, but the nun does not express her agreement, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.2.5_0: If there is no appointment, but he perceives that there is, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.2.6_0: If there is no appointment, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.2.7_0: If there is no appointment, and he perceives that there is not, there is no offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.3.2_0: if it is for the purpose of crossing;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.3.3_0: if they board without an appointment;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.3.4_0: if the nun has made an appointment, but he has not expressed his agreement;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.3.5_0: if they board, but not according to the appointment;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.3.6_0: They burn in times of trouble,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.3.8_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.3.9_0: The eighth rule, the training rule on boarding boats, is finished.
